titleStmt.title: Gods voice from heaven, for direction and consolation to distressed England. Containing a most sweet and heavenly dialogue betweene the Lord and his people: every word of it in the most holy language of Canaan. Wherein the Lord is pleased to make such precious and pregnant promises for the supporting his people against their enemies, and giving them victory over them, as may be a sufficient ground for them to beleeve that God will arise and have mercie upon Sion, for the time of mercies is come.

notesStmt.note: Thomason received his copy in December 1643.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Decem: 4 1643"; the second 4 in the imprint date has been crossed out.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
